title: The Parable of the Tired Bard
subtitle: Sleep is important
description: A short parable about exhaustion, deferred self-care, and the irony of seeking comfort only after consequence forces rest.

motifMap.meaning: Promised comfort that arrives as consequence rather than gift; the irony of getting what you want the wrong way.
Available, ordinary mercy in the present; chosen rest that prevents collapse.
Humble necessity; the simple remedy desired only after injury.
The world's harsh pedagogy; consequence that seals the lesson into the body.

excerpt: “At last, I have my feathers. Now find me a bed of hay.”

associatedMedia.description: Featured image: a tired bard asleep in a warm tavern, head on a lute; candlelight, scattered feathers and straw.
associatedMedia.altText: A weary bard sleeps at a wooden table with a lute, lit by candlelight; feathers and straw on the floor.
